p: Gemcitabine is a cytidine analog that has been clinically used for the treatment of various cancers [ 11, 12]. However, in recent years, the antiviral activity of gemcitabine has also been reported against a broad range of RNA viruses, including Middle East respiratory syndrome coronavirus (MERS-CoV), severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus (SARS-CoV), Zika virus (ZIKV), HCV, poliovirus (PV), influenza A virus (IAV), HIV, and enteroviruses (EV) [ 13, 14, 15, 16, 17, 18].
